name: run_external_periodic_tasks
description: Some periodic tasks can be run in a separate process. Should we run them here?
label: manageability

name: backdoor_port
description: Enable eventlet backdoor.  Acceptable values are 0, <port>, and <start>:<end>, where 0 results in listening on a random tcp port number; <port> results in listening on the specified port  number (and not enabling backdoor if that port is in use); and  <start>:<end> results in listening on the smallest unused  port number within the specified range of port numbers.  The chosen port is displayed in the service's log file.
label: environment

name: backdoor_socket
description: Enable eventlet backdoor, using the provided path as a unix socket  that can receive connections. This option is mutually exclusive with  'backdoor_port' in that only one should be provided. If both are  provided then the existence of this option overrides the usage of that  option.
label: environment

name: log_options
description: Enables or disables logging values of all registered options when starting a service (at DEBUG level).
label: debuggability

name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
description: Specify a timeout after which a gracefully shutdown server will exit. Zero value means endless wait.
label: reliability

name: rpc_conn_pool_size
description: Size of RPC connection pool.
label: performance

name: conn_pool_min_size
description: The pool size limit for connections expiration policy
label: performance

name: conn_pool_ttl
description: The time-to-live in sec of idle connections in the pool
label: reliability

name: executor_thread_pool_size
description: Size of executor thread pool when executor is threading or eventlet.
label: performance

name: rpc_response_timeout
description: Seconds to wait for a response from a call.
label: reliability

name: transport_url
description: The network address and optional user credentials for connecting to  the messaging backend, in URL format. The expected format is:
label: environment

name: control_exchange
description: The default exchange under which topics are scoped. May be overridden by an exchange name specified in the transport_url option.
label: manageability

name: debug
description: If set to true, the logging level will be set to DEBUG instead of the default INFO level.
label: debuggability

name: log_config_append
description: The name of a logging configuration file. This file is appended to  any existing logging configuration files. For details about logging  configuration files, see the Python logging module documentation. Note  that when logging configuration files are used then all logging  configuration is set in the configuration file and other logging  configuration options are ignored (for example, log-date-format).
label: debuggability

name: log_date_format
description: Defines the format string for %(asctime)s in log records. Default:  the value above . This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: log_file
description: (Optional) Name of log file to send logging output to. If no default  is set, logging will go to stderr as defined by use_stderr. This option  is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: log_dir
description: (Optional) The base directory used for relative log_file  paths. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: environment

name: watch_log_file
description: Uses logging handler designed to watch file system. When log file is  moved or removed this handler will open a new log file with specified  path instantaneously. It makes sense only if log_file option is  specified and Linux platform is used. This option is ignored if  log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_syslog
description: Use syslog for logging. Existing syslog format is DEPRECATED and will be changed later to honor RFC5424. This option is ignored if  log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_journal
description: Enable journald for logging. If running in a systemd environment you  may wish to enable journal support. Doing so will use the journal native protocol which includes structured metadata in addition to log  messages.This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: syslog_log_facility
description: Syslog facility to receive log lines. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_json
description: Use JSON formatting for logging. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_stderr
description: Log output to standard error. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.
label: debuggability

name: use_eventlog
description: Log output to Windows Event Log.
label: debuggability

name: log_rotate_interval
description: The amount of time before the log files are rotated. This option is ignored unless log_rotation_type is setto 'interval'.
label: reliability

name: log_rotate_interval_type
description: Rotation interval type. The time of the last file change (or the time when the service was started) is used when scheduling the next  rotation.
label: debuggability

name: max_logfile_count
description: Maximum number of rotated log files.
label: debuggability

name: max_logfile_size_mb

label: debuggability

name: log_rotation_type
description: Log rotation type.
label: debuggability

name: logging_context_format_string

label: debuggability

name: logging_default_format_string
description: Format string to use for log messages when context is undefined. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_debug_format_suffix
description: Additional data to append to log message when logging level for the  message is DEBUG. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_exception_prefix
description: Prefix each line of exception output with this format. Used by oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: logging_user_identity_format
description: Defines the format string for %(user_identity)s that is used in  logging_context_format_string. Used by  oslo_log.formatters.ContextFormatter
label: debuggability

name: default_log_levels
description: List of package logging levels in logger=LEVEL pairs. This option is ignored if log_config_append is set.

name: publish_errors
description: Enables or disables publication of error events.
label: debuggability

name: instance_format

label: manageability

name: instance_uuid_format
description: The format for an instance UUID that is passed with the log message.
label: manageability

name: rate_limit_interval
description: Interval, number of seconds, of log rate limiting.

name: rate_limit_burst
description: Maximum number of logged messages per rate_limit_interval.
label: reliability

name: rate_limit_except_level
description: Log level name used by rate limiting: CRITICAL, ERROR, INFO, WARNING, DEBUG or empty string. Logs with level greater or equal to  rate_limit_except_level are not filtered. An empty string means that all levels are filtered.
label: debuggability

name: fatal_deprecations
description: Enables or disables fatal status of deprecations.
label: manageability

name: manage_agent_boot
description: Whether Ironic will manage booting of the agent ramdisk. If set to  False, you will need to configure your mechanism to allow booting the  agent ramdisk.
label: manageability

name: memory_consumed_by_agent
description: The memory size in MiB consumed by agent when it is booted on a bare  metal node. This is used for checking if the image can be downloaded and deployed on the bare metal node after booting agent ramdisk. This may  be set according to the memory consumed by the agent ramdisk image.
label: performance

name: stream_raw_images
description: Whether the agent ramdisk should stream raw images directly onto the  disk or not. By streaming raw images directly onto the disk the agent  ramdisk will not spend time copying the image to a tmpfs partition  (therefore consuming less memory) prior to writing it to the disk.  Unless the disk where the image will be copied to is really slow, this  option should be set to True. Defaults to True.
label: performance

name: post_deploy_get_power_state_retries
description: Number of times to retry getting power state to check if bare metal node has been powered off after a soft power off.
label: reliability

name: post_deploy_get_power_state_retry_interval
description: Amount of time (in seconds) to wait between polling power state after trigger soft poweroff.
label: reliability

name: agent_api_version
description: API version to use for communicating with the ramdisk agent.
label: environment

name: deploy_logs_collect
description: Whether Ironic should collect the deployment logs on deployment failure (on_failure), always or never.
label: debuggability

name: deploy_logs_storage_backend
description: The name of the storage backend where the logs will be stored.
label: debuggability

name: deploy_logs_local_path
description: The path to the directory where the logs should be stored, used when the deploy_logs_storage_backend is configured to 'local'.
label: environment

name: deploy_logs_swift_container
description: The name of the Swift container to store the logs, used when the deploy_logs_storage_backend is configured to 'swift'.
label: debuggability

name: deploy_logs_swift_days_to_expire
description: Number of days before a log object is marked as expired in Swift. If  None, the logs will be kept forever or until manually deleted. Used when the deploy_logs_storage_backend is configured to 'swift'.
label: debuggability

name: image_download_source
description: Specifies whether direct deploy interface should try to use the image source directly or if ironic should cache the image on the conductor  and serve it from ironic's own http server. This option takes effect  only when instance image is provided from the Image service.
label: manageability

name: command_timeout
description: Timeout (in seconds) for IPA commands.
label: reliability

name: max_command_attempts
description: This is the maximum number of attempts that will be done for IPA commands that fails due to network problems.
label: reliability

name: neutron_agent_poll_interval
description: The number of seconds Neutron agent will wait between polling for  device changes. This value should be the same as  CONF.AGENT.polling_interval in Neutron configuration.
label: reliability

name: neutron_agent_max_attempts
description: Max number of attempts to validate a Neutron agent status before raising network error for a dead agent.
label: reliability

name: neutron_agent_status_retry_interval
description: Wait time in seconds between attempts for validating Neutron agent status.
label: reliability

name: ansible_extra_args
description: Extra arguments to pass on every invocation of Ansible.
label: manageability

name: verbosity
description: Set ansible verbosity level requested when invoking  'ansible-playbook' command. 4 includes detailed SSH session logging.  Default is 4 when global debug is enabled and 0 otherwise.
label: debuggability

name: ansible_playbook_script
description: Path to 'ansible-playbook' script. Default will search the $PATH  configured for user running ironic-conductor process. Provide the full  path when ansible-playbook is not in $PATH or installed in not default  location.
label: environment

name: playbooks_path
description: Path to directory with playbooks, roles and local inventory.
label: environment

name: config_file_path
description: Path to ansible configuration file. If set to empty, system default will be used.
label: environment

name: post_deploy_get_power_state_retries
description: Number of times to retry getting power state to check if bare metal  node has been powered off after a soft power off. Value of 0 means do  not retry on failure.
label: reliability

name: post_deploy_get_power_state_retry_interval
description: Amount of time (in seconds) to wait between polling power state after trigger soft poweroff.
label: reliability

name: extra_memory
description: Extra amount of memory in MiB expected to be consumed by  Ansible-related processes on the node. Affects decision whether image  will fit into RAM.
label: performance

name: image_store_insecure
description: Skip verifying SSL connections to the image store when downloading  the image. Setting it to 'True' is only recommended for testing  environments that use self-signed certificates.
label: security

name: image_store_cafile
description: Specific CA bundle to use for validating SSL connections to the image store. If not specified, CA available in the ramdisk will be used. Is  not used by default playbooks included with the driver. Suitable for  environments that use self-signed certificates.
label: security

name: image_store_certfile
description: Client cert to use for SSL connections to image store. Is not used by default playbooks included with the driver.
label: security

name: image_store_keyfile
description: Client key to use for SSL connections to image store. Is not used by default playbooks included with the driver.
label: security

name: default_username
description: Name of the user to use for Ansible when connecting to the ramdisk  over SSH. It may be overridden by per-node 'ansible_username' option in  node's 'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_key_file
description: Absolute path to the private SSH key file to use by Ansible by  default when connecting to the ramdisk over SSH. Default is to use  default SSH keys configured for the user running the ironic-conductor  service. Private keys with password must be pre-loaded into 'ssh-agent'. It may be overridden by per-node 'ansible_key_file' option in node's  'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_deploy_playbook
description: Path (relative to $playbooks_path or absolute) to the default  playbook used for deployment. It may be overridden by per-node  'ansible_deploy_playbook' option in node's 'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_shutdown_playbook
description: Path (relative to $playbooks_path or absolute) to the default  playbook used for graceful in-band shutdown of the node. It may be  overridden by per-node 'ansible_shutdown_playbook' option in node's  'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_clean_playbook
description: Path (relative to $playbooks_path or absolute) to the default  playbook used for node cleaning. It may be overridden by per-node  'ansible_clean_playbook' option in node's 'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_clean_steps_config
description: Path (relative to $playbooks_path or absolute) to the default  auxiliary cleaning steps file used during the node cleaning. It may be  overridden by per-node 'ansible_clean_steps_config' option in node's  'driver_info' field.
label: environment

name: default_python_interpreter
description: Absolute path to the python interpreter on the managed machines. It  may be overridden by per-node 'ansible_python_interpreter' option in  node's 'driver_info' field. By default, ansible uses /usr/bin/python
label: environment

name: host_ip
description: The IP address or hostname on which ironic-api listens.
label: environment

name: port
description: The TCP port on which ironic-api listens.
label: environment

name: max_limit
description: The maximum number of items returned in a single response from a collection resource.
label: performance

name: public_endpoint
description: Public URL to use when building the links to the API resources (for example, 'https://ironic.rocks:6384'). If None the links will be built using the request's host URL. If the  API is operating behind a proxy, you will want to change this to  represent the proxy's URL. Defaults to None.
label: environment

name: api_workers
description: Number of workers for OpenStack Ironic API service. The default is  equal to the number of CPUs available if that can be determined, else a  default worker count of 1 is returned.
label: performance

name: enable_ssl_api
description: Enable the integrated stand-alone API to service requests via HTTPS  instead of HTTP. If there is a front-end service performing HTTPS  offloading from the service, this option should be False; note, you will want to change public API endpoint to represent SSL termination URL  with 'public_endpoint' option.
label: security

name: restrict_lookup
description: Whether to restrict the lookup API to only nodes in certain states.
label: security

name: ramdisk_heartbeat_timeout

label: reliability

name: enabled

label: security

name: audit_map_file
description: Path to audit map file for ironic-api service. Used only when API audit is enabled.
label: security

name: ignore_req_list
description: Comma separated list of Ironic REST API HTTP methods to be ignored  during audit logging. For example: auditing will not be done on any GET  or POST requests if this is set to 'GET,POST'. It is used only when API  audit is enabled.

name: max_retry

label: reliability

name: action_interval

label: reliability

name: action_retries
description: Number of retries in the case of a failed action (currently only used when detaching volumes).

name: action_retry_interval
description: Retry interval in seconds in the case of a failed action (only specific actions are retried).
label: reliability

name: collect_timing

name: default_domain_id
description: Optional domain ID to use with v3 and v2 parameters. It will be used  for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2  authentication.
label: environment

name: default_domain_name
description: Optional domain name to use with v3 API and v2 parameters. It will be used for both the user and project domain in v3 and ignored in v2  authentication.

name: domain_name

name: keyfile

label: environment

description: The maximum major version of a given API, intended to be used as the  upper bound of a range with min_version. Mutually exclusive with  version.

name: min_version
description: The minimum major version of a given API, intended to be used as the  lower bound of a range with max_version. Mutually exclusive with  version. If min_version is given with no max_version it is as if max  version is 'latest'.

name: project_domain_id

name: project_domain_name
description: Domain name containing project
label: environment

name: project_id
description: Project ID to scope to
label: environment

name: project_name
description: Project name to scope to
label: environment

name: region_name
description: The default region_name for endpoint URL discovery.
label: environment

name: retries
description: Client retries in the case of a failed request connection.

name: service_name

label: environment

name: service_type
description: The default service_type for endpoint URL discovery.
label: manageability

name: split_loggers
description: Log requests to multiple loggers.
label: debuggability

description: Scope for system operations

description: Tenant Name

label: environment

name: max_retry

name: action_interval
description: Amount of time in seconds to wait in between power operations
label: reliability

name: workers_pool_size
description: The size of the workers greenthread pool. Note that 2 threads will be reserved by the conductor itself for handling heart beats and periodic  tasks. On top of that, sync_power_state_workers will take up to 7 green threads with the default value of 8.
label: performance

name: heartbeat_interval
description: Seconds between conductor heart beats.
label: reliability

name: api_url
description: URL of Ironic API service. If not set ironic can get the current  value from the keystone service catalog. If set, the value must start  with either http:// or https://.
label: environment

name: heartbeat_timeout
description: Maximum time (in seconds) since the last check-in of a conductor. A  conductor is considered inactive when this time has been exceeded.
label: reliability

name: sync_power_state_interval
description: Interval between syncing the node power state to the database, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable syncing.
label: reliability

name: check_provision_state_interval
description: Interval between checks of provision timeouts, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable checks.
label: reliability

name: check_rescue_state_interval
description: Interval (seconds) between checks of rescue timeouts.

name: check_allocations_interval
description: Interval between checks of orphaned allocations, in seconds. Set to 0 to disable checks.

name: deploy_callback_timeout

name: force_power_state_during_sync

name: power_state_sync_max_retries
description: During sync_power_state failures, limit the number of times Ironic  should try syncing the hardware node power state with the node power  state in DB
label: reliability

name: sync_power_state_workers
description: The maximum number of worker threads that can be started simultaneously to sync nodes power states from the periodic task.
label: performance

name: periodic_max_workers
description: Maximum number of worker threads that can be started simultaneously  by a periodic task. Should be less than RPC thread pool size.
label: performance

name: node_locked_retry_attempts
description: Number of attempts to grab a node lock.
label: reliability

name: node_locked_retry_interval
description: Seconds to sleep between node lock attempts.
label: reliability

name: send_sensor_data
description: Enable sending sensor data message via the notification bus
label: manageability

name: send_sensor_data_interval
description: Seconds between conductor sending sensor data message to ceilometer via the notification bus.
label: reliability

name: send_sensor_data_workers
description: The maximum number of workers that can be started simultaneously for send data from sensors periodic task.
label: performance

name: send_sensor_data_wait_timeout
description: The time in seconds to wait for send sensors data periodic task to be finished before allowing periodic call to happen again. Should be less  than send_sensor_data_interval value.

name: send_sensor_data_types
description: List of comma separated meter types which need to be sent to  Ceilometer. The default value, 'ALL', is a special value meaning send  all the sensor data.

name: sync_local_state_interval
description: When conductors join or leave the cluster, existing conductors may  need to update any persistent local state as nodes are moved around the  cluster. label: reliability

name: configdrive_swift_container
description: Name of the Swift container to store config drive data. Used when configdrive_use_object_store is True.

name: configdrive_swift_temp_url_duration
description: The timeout (in seconds) after which a configdrive temporary URL  becomes invalid. Defaults to deploy_callback_timeout if it is set,  otherwise to 1800 seconds. Used when configdrive_use_object_store is  True.

name: inspect_wait_timeout
description: Timeout (seconds) for waiting for node inspection. 0 - unlimited.
label: reliability

name: automated_clean
description: Enables or disables automated cleaning. Automated cleaning is a  configurable set of steps, such as erasing disk drives, that are  performed on the node to ensure it is in a baseline state and ready to  be deployed to. This is done after instance deletion as well as during  the transition from a 'manageable' to 'available' state. When enabled,  the particular steps performed to clean a node depend on which driver  that node is managed by; see the individual driver's documentation for  details. NOTE: The introduction of the cleaning operation causes  instance deletion to take significantly longer. In an environment where  all tenants are trusted (eg, because there is only one tenant), this  option could be safely disabled.

name: clean_callback_timeout

name: rescue_callback_timeout
description: Timeout (seconds) to wait for a callback from the rescue ramdisk. If  the timeout is reached the node will be put in the 'rescue failed'  provision state. Set to 0 to disable timeout.
label: reliability

name: soft_power_off_timeout
description: Timeout (in seconds) of soft reboot and soft power off operation. This value always has to be positive.
label: reliability

name: power_state_change_timeout
description: Number of seconds to wait for power operations to complete, i.e., so  that a baremetal node is in the desired power state. If timed out, the  power operation is considered a failure.
label: reliability

name: power_failure_recovery_interval

name: conductor_group

name: allow_deleting_available_nodes

name: terminal

name: terminal_cert_dir

name: terminal_pid_dir

name: subprocess_checking_interval

name: max_age

label: performance

name: allow_methods
description: Indicate which methods can be used during the actual request.
label: security

name: allow_headers
description: Indicate which header field names may be used during the actual request.
label: security

name: sqlite_synchronous
description: If True, SQLite uses synchronous mode.

name: backend

name: connection

name: slave_connection

Unauthenticated clients are redirected to this endpoint to authenticate. Although this endpoint should ideally be unversioned, client support in the wild varies. If you're using a versioned v2 endpoint here, then  this should not be the same endpoint the service user utilizes  for validating tokens, because normal end users may not be able to reach that endpoint. This option is deprecated in favor of  www_authenticate_uri and will be removed in the S release.

description: In order to prevent excessive effort spent validating tokens, the  middleware caches previously-seen tokens for a configurable duration (in seconds). Set to -1 to disable caching completely.

name: memcache_security_strategy
description: (Optional) If defined, indicate whether token data should be  authenticated or authenticated and encrypted. If MAC, token data is  authenticated (with HMAC) in the cache. If ENCRYPT, token data is  encrypted and authenticated in the cache. If the value is not one of  these options or empty, auth_token will raise an exception on  initialization.
label: security

name: memcache_secret_key
description: (Optional, mandatory if memcache_security_strategy is defined) This string is used for key derivation.
label: security

name: memcache_pool_dead_retry
description: (Optional) Number of seconds memcached server is considered dead before it is tried again.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_maxsize
description: (Optional) Maximum total number of open connections to every memcached server.
label: performance

name: memcache_pool_socket_timeout
description: (Optional) Socket timeout in seconds for communicating with a memcached server.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_unused_timeout
description: (Optional) Number of seconds a connection to memcached is held unused in the pool before it is closed.
label: reliability

name: memcache_pool_conn_get_timeout
description: (Optional) Number of seconds that an operation will wait to get a memcached client connection from the pool.
label: reliability

name: memcache_use_advanced_pool
description: (Optional) Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. The advanced pool will only work under python 2.x.
label: security

name: include_service_catalog
description: (Optional) Indicate whether to set the X-Service-Catalog header. If  False, middleware will not ask for service catalog on token validation  and will not set the X-Service-Catalog header.
label: manageability

name: enforce_token_bind
description: Used to control the use and type of token binding. Can be set to:  'disabled' to not check token binding. 'permissive' (default) to  validate binding information if the bind type is of a form known to the  server and ignore it if not. 'strict' like 'permissive' but if the bind  type is unknown the token will be rejected. 'required' any form of token binding is needed to be allowed. Finally the name of a binding method  that must be present in tokens.
label: security

name: hash_algorithms
description: Hash algorithms to use for hashing PKI tokens. This may be a single  algorithm or multiple. The algorithms are those supported by Python  standard hashlib.new(). The hashes will be tried in the order given, so  put the preferred one first for performance. The result of the first  hash will be stored in the cache. This will typically be set to multiple values only while migrating from a less secure algorithm to a more  secure one. Once all the old tokens are expired this option should be  set to a single value for better performance.
label: performance

name: service_token_roles
description: A choice of roles that must be present in a service token. Service  tokens are allowed to request that an expired token can be used and so  this check should tightly control that only actual services should be  sending this token. Roles here are applied as an ANY check so any role  in this list must be present. For backwards compatibility reasons this  currently only affects the allow_expired check.
label: manageability

name: service_token_roles_required
description: For backwards compatibility reasons we must let valid service tokens  pass that don't pass the service_token_roles check as valid. Setting  this true will become the default in a future release and should be  enabled if possible.
